answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.The report is not clear. What was the final impression? There is mild mitral regurgitation and left ventricular hypertrophy. But the ejection fraction is good. The ejection fraction is a useful measure of left ventricular performance. The normal range is 63-77% for males and 55-75% for females. It reflects the pumping capacity of the heart.Check to see if you have hypertension, this could cause left ventricular hypertrophy.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

hi....thank you for your answer...its really helping me a lot...yeah my father had hypertension since 1990...(>20 years) and on medication...the report i cant find more....its the thing i only found in the form :( by the way thanks ver much :) :) :)
Its probably the LA that is dilated, likely due to long term high blood pressure, a fact supported by the LVH,no cause for immediate concern, function is good, valves are fine, control the BP,
ok...thx...:) :) :) so far his BP is ok..with medications...

question: hi..just now i bring my dad to an echo appointment...then the report was saying thatleft ventrice: LVH +(1.4cm)mitral valve:trivial MRaortic valve: no AR,mild AS with PPG 17mmHg/MPG 7mmHg,thickened aortic valve(RCC,NCC,LCC)good LV systolic function with EF 64%-NA(looks like that but im not confirm becoz the writing is quite bad...hehe) or VA = dilated size (4.4 cm)so is this a serious case or actually whats the problem...i cant ask there as there are many people wanna do the echo...he told me to go to clinic with an appointment on june..i just worried if its late..my dad is a diabetes and hpt patient for about 20 years...and last year april he got UGIB.. november (decom CCF)..and recently leg cellulitis.
title: -echo report-
